Ps 961 3 10ac 11 13 Mt 1812 14 Wed Dec 11St Damascus I Pope Is 4025 31 Ps 1031 4 8 10 Mt 1128 30 Thurs Dec 12 Our Lady of Guadalupe Zec 214 17 or Rv 1119a 121 6a 10ab Ps Jdt 1318b 19 Lk 126 38 or Lk Sun Dec 15 Third Sunday of Advent Zep 314 18a Ps Is 122 6 Phil 44 7 Lk 310 18 Second Sunday of Advent December 8 2024 This weekend December 7th8th the Church celebrates the Second Sunday of Advent Given how near Christmastide is the Church now begins to turn her attention from the Second Coming of Christ at the end of time itself to His first coming in time at the Nativity This shift is seen in our Gospel today through the words of St John the Baptist the forerunner and herald of the Christ His words bore witness to the Redeemer's coming With the start of the new liturgical year last weekend we also began a new year in our three year lectionary cycle Having entered into Year of the cycle we are now walking through the life of our Lord according to the Gospel of St Luke This Gospel is itself divided into four main sections The Infancy Narratives Luke 1 2 the Early Ministry Luke 3 9 the Travel Narrative Luke 10 19 and Holy Week Luke 20 24 Briefly breaking these four sections apart we see that in Lukes account of Jesus life we will walk through 1 His birth in Bethlehem and upbringing in Nazareth Luke 1 2 2 Nearly one year of His ministry in Galilee Luke 3 9 3 The momentous death march to Jerusalem in the final year of His life Luke 10 19 and 4 The dramatic events of His Passion by which He ushered in the New Covenant Luke 20 24 see especially 2220 This Gospel is the first of a two volume work continued in the Acts of the Apostles St Luke first shows how God's promises to Israel are fulfilled in Jesus and how the salvation promised to Israel and has been accomplished by Jesus and extended to the Gentiles Continuing in Acts there is the assurance that the historical ministry of Jesus is continued in the ministry of the apostles and this ensures the fidelity of the Church's teaching to the teaching of Jesus Solemnity of the Immaculate Conception Holy Day of Obligation On Monday December 9th the Church celebrates the Solemnity of the Immaculate Conception which is a Holy Day of Obligation Though this celebration normally falls on December 8th it was transferred this year as its original date falls on the Second Sunday of Advent Given that our nation has been entrusted to the Blessed Mother under this title this is our nation's patronal feast day and as such one we desire to celebrate yearly To help provide for our obligation to assist at Mass on this day we will offer Masses for the Holy Day of Obligation on Monday December 9th at 7:00AM Noon and 7:00PM Additional Holy Day Mass Times at surrounding parishes St Aloysius in Yoder Sunday Dec 8th at 6:30PM and Monday Dec 9th at 9:00AM and 6:30PM St Mary's in Decatur Sunday Dec 8th at 6:00PM and Monday Dec 9th at 8:10AM Noon and 6:00PM Advent Penance Service This coming Wednesday December 11th we will have our annual Advent Penance Service from 600 7:00PM in the Church We will be joined by four priests to help with hearing confessions I would encourage you to join us especially if it may have been some time since you've last had a chance to avail yourself of this wondrous Sacrament What better way to prepare our hearts for Christmas Day than to give it over to the Lord in Confession Advent Baby Shower As a part of our almsgiving this Advent we are taking up donations to help support Helping Hands one of our local pregnancy and family resource centers Helping Hands is in need of diapers laundry detergent dish soap and non perishable food items These donations will go to support the various families that Helping Hands supports in our community Please see this weekend's insert for more information regarding donations and various volunteer opportunities available through Helping Hands Any donations to our annual Advent Baby Shower can be placed in the playpen in the narthex through
